editorialDecl.p:
校訂文全体凡例
・ 原則として土本（以下、略称は「主要写本・版本・刊本等略称・底本一覧」参照）を底本とし、九本・剛本・条本・花本等の古写本や近本・壬本・京博本等の写本によって対校しました（巻によって使用した対校本は異なります）。
・ 条文番号・条文名称は原則として訳注本に拠りましたが、一部を修正しています（※下記「条文名称修正一覧」参照）。なお1条が長い場合など、必要に応じ「項」に分割して示すこととしました。
・ 校異は原則として底本の文字を改変する場合、あるいは写本間に参考とすべき異同がある場合、参考とすべき傍書等がある場合に付すこととしました。必ずしもその校異に関する写本をすべて網羅することはせず、主要写本のみを取り上げています。ただし訳注本と校訂文に異同が生じた場合には、できる限り校異にて言及するよう心がけました（単なる字体の相違については省略しています）。
・ 校訂文は『延喜式』撰上当初の姿の復元を目標としています。標注や傍書は、条文名称に関わるものは省略し、中世以前にさかのぼることが想定されるものに限って、校異注で言及することとしました。ただし標注のうち「弘」「貞」「延」等については便宜を考え、鉤括弧で括って校訂本文に掲げることとしました。
・ 字体は常用漢字体を原則としました。「大」と「太」、「座」と「坐」、「絇」と「約」、「績」と「續（続）」、「色」と「包」、「細」と「紬」、「鈍」と「純」、「冑」と「胃」、「絁」と「絶」、草冠と竹冠、木偏と手偏等、容易に判定される誤字や誤用・通用については、校異を省略して適宜置き換える場合があります。ただし巻9・10においては「大」「太」の差異も校異にて触れることとしました。
・ 校訂文中の細字・割書は、〈 〉で括って表現することとしました。
・ 本文に誤字・脱字等が想定される場合であっても、置き換えるべき文字や補うべき文字が明確でない場合は、校異注での言及にとどめた場合があります。
・ ユニコードにて表示されない漢字は以下のように示すことにしました。
【Ａ+Ｂ】 ＝扁がＡ、つくりがＢ 例）村【木+寸】
【Ａ/Ｂ】 ＝上にＡ、下にＢ 例）雲【雨/云】
【Ａ-Ｂ】 ＝Ａの字画よりＢにあたる字画を除く 例）門【閉-オ】
【Ａ⊃Ｂ】 ＝Ａの字画のなかにＢの字画が含まれる 例）閉【門⊃オ】、国【囗⊃玉】
・ 校異註の付く文字は赤字で表示され、クリックすると註が表示されます。表示内容は以下の通りです。
採用 写本名と校訂文にて採用した文字
校異 写本名と対校箇所の文字
解説 各写本の傍書や頭書等の提示、校異註の本文（最下部の解説）
・ 条文名称修正一覧
巻番号 旧番号 旧条文名 番号 訂正条文名
111太政官 67 薗韓神祭 67 園韓神祭
111太政官 112 行幸経宿 112 行幸経旬
171内匠 39 作物衣服 39 作物衣

293囚獄 2 著鈦盤枷 2 着鈦盤枷
321大膳上 5 新嘗祭 5･6 新嘗祭と新嘗小斎解斎に分割
411弾正 68 支子染深色 68 支子染色

div.p: ANNOTATED ENGLISH TRANSLATION OF SCROLL 37 OF THE *ENGI SHIKI/*
PROCEDURES OF THE BUREAU OF MEDICATIONS

div.note: On the royal medications of New Year's Day 〈follow this model for the royal consort.〉
div.p:
On the royal medications of New Year's Day１ 〈follow this model for the royal consort.〉
*Byakusan/*, one dose; *doshōsan/*, one dose; *toso/*, one dose; ointment for a thousand poxes and ten-thousand maladies, one dose.
For the offering of the medications prepare: three lacquered tables 〈place the powder medications [*byakusan/* and *doshōsan/*] and the ointment on one table; the *toso/* and the tripod pot on another; the sake cup on a decorated table〉 one silver *sake/* cup, one silver plate, one small white bronze bowl, four bronze sake cups, eight red-lacquered plates to collect leftovers 〈diameter eight *sun/*, store them in the Bureau〉

one pouch 〈length two *shaku/* and three *sun/*〉 one *ryō/* in strings for the pouch, twenty sheets of paper, and three *bu/* of mulberry bark strings.
For the preparation of the medications arrange: seven *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *ninjin/* [*Panax ginseng/*/Asian ginseng root] ; six *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kanzō/* [*Glycyrrhiza uralensis/*/Chinese licorice root and rhizome]; three *bu/* of *keishin/* [*Cinnamomum cassia/*/Chinese cinnamon] 〈obtain them from the Royal Storehouse Bureau;〉 two *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *byakujutsu/* [*Atractylodes japonica/* rhizome]; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *daiō/* [*Rheum palmatum/*/Chinese rhubarb]; three *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *bushi/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shokushō/* [*Zanthoxylum piperitum/* f. *inerme/*/sanshō peppercorn]; three *bu/* of *bōfū/* [*Saposhnikovia divaricate/*/siler root]; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *uzu/*; three *ryō/* of *saishin/* [*Asarum sieboldin/* dried plant]; two *bu/* of *bakkatsu/* [*Smilax china/*/China root]; one *bu/* of *kankyō/* [*Zingiber officinale/*/dried ginger root]; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *maō/* [*Ephedra sinica/*/Chinese ephedra stem]; three *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *kikyō/* [*Platycodon grandifloras/*/Chinese bellflower root]; one *ryō/* of *tōki/* [*Angelica acutiloba/*/Japanese angelica root]; two *ryō/* of *daigeki/* [*Euphorbia pekinensis/* root]; one *ryō/* of *shōma/* [*Astilbe thunbergia/*/Thunberg's astilbe rhizome]; one *ryō/* of *byakushi/* [*Angelica dahurica/*/Dahurian angelica root]; one *ryō/* of *shakuyaku/* [*Paeonia lactiflora/*/Chinese peony root]; one *ryō/* of *hōsō/* [aerial part of *Illicium anisatum/*/Japanese anise]; one *ryō/* of *ōgon/* [*Scutellaria baicalensis/*/Chinese skullcap root]; one *ryō/* of *dokkatsu/* [*Angelica pubescens/*/pubescent angelica root]; one *ryō/* of *jagan/* [leaves of *Potentilla anemonifolia/*]; five *ryō/* of *kijiō/* [*Rehmannia glutinosa/*/Chinese foxglove rhizome]; and twenty stalks of *gaihaku/* [*Allium macrostemon/*/long-stamen onion bulb] 〈as for all which is listed above, obtain it from the storehouse of the Bureau; 〉 four *shō/* of bitter vinegar; ten *kin/* of wild boar fat; four *shaku/* of silk sieve for the medications; two large containers; two *oribitsu/* containers; and one *koku/* of new charcoal.

As for the above [medications], make and prepare them according to precedent from the last third of the eleventh month to the last third of the twelfth month. As for the miscellaneous items that will be needed, inform the Ministry [of the Royal Household] on the fifteenth day of the tenth month. The Ministry will inform the Council [of State], which will issue a directive to the offices involved. [The Bureau of Medications] will receive and prepare [what is needed] within the first third of the eleventh month. As for other miscellaneous items, adjust their quantity depending on the circumstances. Supply all those involved in the production of the medications with a rank lower than the four administrative positions and higher than minor functionary with pure clothes 〈also provide each of those of a rank lower than the four administrative positions and higher than apprentice of medications with one *hiki/* and three *jō* of coarse plain silk and three *ton/* of silk floss; to the apprentices [of medications] who have yet to receive a performance evaluation and to the minor functionaries provide one *tan/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind. 〉 Provide them with *sake/* and food for no longer than twenty-eight days.
Provide with pure clothes those who will offer the royal medications on New Year's Day: the director of the Office of Medications 〈in the case of the royal consort and the heir apparent, one vice-director of the Office of Medications each,〉 five female minor functionaries, and two female attendants. Give each one *jō/* of coarse plain silk and two *ton/* of silk floss 〈as for the color, choose in accordance with the propitious direction for the year [as divined by the Bureau of Yin and Yang]. Submit a lateral memorandum to the Bureau of Yin and Yang beforehand, wait for their response and afterwards request [the clothes]. Follow the same procedure also for the royal consort and the heir apparent.〉

On the last day of the twelfth month, in the first quarter of the time of the hare [5-7 AM], the Ministry of the Royal Household and the Bureau will proceed together outside the Ensei gate. After the Office of Inner Gatekeepers have announced them to the *tennō/*, the high-ranking officials of the Bureau, preceding the apprentices of medications and the others, will carry the table on which the medications have been placed, and will together enter the courtyard [located south of the Shishinden] and put the table down south of the ceremonial marker; after this, they will withdraw in order. After the Ministry of the Royal Household have announced them to the *tennō/*, they will again enter and leave with the table; then they will pass it on to the director of the Office of Medications. As for the *toso/*, the officials will guide the apprentices of medications and, on that same day, at the time of the horse [11 AM - 1 PM] will place it inside [the pouch] and steep it into the well; have officials from the Office of Water Management guard it. On New Year's Day, in the first quarter of the time of the tiger [3-5 AM], the officials will guide the apprentices of medications, approach the well and take out the medication, then a vice-director of the Ministry of the Royal Household and the officials of the Bureau will enter the yard of the royal residence carrying the medication, then proceed and place it down. Afterwards, using the silver tripod pot, they will heat up the *sake/* and steep the *toso/* [in it]. The Office of the Brewery will provide the *sake/* and the Bureau of Supplies will prepare the brazier. A vice-director of the Office of Medications will take the *sake/* cup and guide the female attendants to the designated place; he will have the young female attendants 〈chosen by the *tennō/* and courtiers〉 from the Office of Medications lick [the *toso/*] beforehand, and will then offer it to the *tennō/*. Following this, do the same with the *byakusan/* and *doshōsan/*. End this on the third day. Follow the same procedure for the royal consort and the heir apparent.

Afterwards, as for the payment of remunerations, give those of the fifth rank an *aoshi/*, a lined kimono worn as a jacket in winter; to the third- and forth-level managers, to the royal physician, and to the instructor women's physician give one *ren/* of silk floss each; to the minor functionaries and to the seventeen apprentices of medications, give each three *ton/* of silk floss; to the vice-director of the Office of Medications and to the six five female minor functionaries, give each five *ton/* of silk floss.

div.note: On the royal medications of the twelfth month
div.p:
On the royal medications of the twelfth month
Rhinoceros horn pellet, six doses; *shakuyaku/* [*Paeonia lactiflora/*/white peony root] pellet, three doses; *onpaku/* pellets, four doses; ointment for a thousand poxes and ten-thousand maladies, one dose; *shōma/* [*Astilbe thunbergia/*] ointment, two doses; Jīvaka's ointment, one dose; *chōchū/* pellets, two doses; *bōshō/* [mirabilite] black pellets, one dose; fermented soy bean pellets, one dose; four lacquered tables to present the medications; four small continental-style chests and four long tables to carry loads 〈all lacquered. Store them in the Bureau.〉

For the preparation of the medications arrange: one *kin/*, three *ryō/* and two *bu/* of rhinoceros horn; seven *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kanzō/*; eleven *ryō/*, one *bu/* and three *shu/* of *hazu/* [*Croton tiglium/*/purging croton root]; four *ryō/* of *keishin/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kunrokukō/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *fūkō/*; two small *to/*, five *shō/* and seven *gō/* of honey 〈as for the above, obtain them all from the Bureau of the Royal Storehouse;〉

ten *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shōma/*; one *kin/* and five *ryō/* of *ōgon/*; seven *ryō/* of *tōki/*; six *ryō/* of *bōfū/*; six *ryō/* of *maō/*; eight *ryō/* of *ninjin/*; six *ryō/* of *ōgi/* [*Astragalus/*/milkvetch]; nine *ryō/* of *shishinin/* [kernel of *Gardenia jasminoides/* fruit]; six *ryō/* of *kanran/*; four *ryō/* of *bōki/* [*Peucedanum japonicum/*/hogfennel rhizome]; ten *ryō/* of *ōren/* [*Coptis japonica/*/Japanese goldthread rhizome]; nine *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *shakuyaku/*; nine *ryō/* of *teirekishi/* [seeds of *Draba nemorosa/*/wood whitlow-grass]; twelve *ryō/* of bitter apricot [*Prunus armeniaca/*] kernels; eight *ryō/* of *saiko/* [*Bupleurum chinense/*/Chinese thoroughwax root]; two *kin/*, fifteen *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *daiō/* [*Rheum officinale/*/Chinese rhubarb root]; ten *ryō/* of *uzu/*; two *ryō/* of *shion/* [*Aster tataricus/*/Tartarian aster root]; two *ryō/* of *goshuyu/* [*Tetradium ruticarpum/*/Evodia dried fruit]; two *ryō/* of *shōbu/* [*Acorus calamus/*/sweet flag rhizome]; two *ryō/* of *kōboku/* [bark of *Magnolia officinalis/*/magnolia bark]; two *ryō/* of *kikyō/*; two *ryō/* of *sōkyō/* [*Gleditsia sinensis/*/Chinese honeylocust fruit]; six *ryō/* of *bukuryō/* [dried sclerotium of *Wolfiporia extensa/*]; two *ryō/* of *kankyō/*; three *ryō/* of *shokushō/*; two *ryō/* of *zenko/* [*Peucedanum praeruptorum/*/peucedanum root]; six *ryō/* of hemp [*Cannabis sativa/*] seeds; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of dragon bones; four *ryō/* of tortoise shell; sixty sheets of *eupolyphaga sinensis/*; eight *ryō/* of *kijitsu/*; three *ryō/* of *saishin/*; one *kin/* and two *ryō/* of *bōshō/*; one *ryō/* of *karōkon/* [root of *Trichosanthes kirilowii/*/Chinese snake gourd]; one *ryō/* of *ryūtan/* [*Gentiana scabra/*/Chinese gentian root and rhizome]; one *ryō/* of *kujin/* [*Sophora flavescens/*/shrubby sophora root]; six *ryō/* and two *bu/* of fermented soy beans; two *ryō/* of *daigeki/*; one *ryō/* of *hōsō/*; one *ryō/* of *kyūkyū/* [*Ligusticum striatum/*/Sichuan lovage rhizome]; one *ryō/* of *dokkatsu/*; seven *ryō/* of *jagan/*; one *ryō/* of *bushi/*; five *ryō/* of *kijiō/*; twenty stalks of *gaihaku/*; six *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakuren/* [*Ampelopsis japonica/*/Japanese peppervine root]; four *ryō/* of *rōro/* [root of *Echinops setifer/*]; four *ryō/* of *rengyō/* [*Forsythia suspensa/*/forsythia dried fruit]; eight *ryō/* of *sokuzu/* [*Sambucus chinensis/*/Chinese elderberry]; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of pine resin; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakubi/* [*Osmunda japonica/* root]; three *ryō/* of *seimokkō/* [stem and root of *Aucuba japonica/*/Japanese laurel] 〈as for all which is listed above, obtain it from the storehouse of the Bureau;〉

one *kin/*, ten *ryō/* and three *bu/* of wild board fat; five *shō/* each of *sake/* and rice vinegar; two *jō/* of oiled cloth; one *jō/* of coarse plain silk; two *shaku/* of silk gauze; one *kin/* of silk floss; three *jō/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind; for large *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings from Aki province; forty sheets of paper; three Sue ware bowls, three jars, three plates, ten box-shaped *sake/* cups, three washing basins, two *tataibe/* pots; two carrying-vessels; two water buckets; two ladles; two large containers; halved dried gourd used as a ladle; two *oribitsu/* containers; two *koku/* and five *to/* of new charcoal; one grindstone; four long straw mats; four long wild rice leaf mats 〈use these for the production of the stock of medications for the royal consort and the miscellaneous allowance [of medications for court bureaucrats of the fifth rank and above].〉

As for the above [medications], make and prepare them together with the royal medications of New Year's Day and present them to the *tennō/* on the last day of the year. As for the miscellaneous items that will be needed, do as for the materials used for [the medications for the *tennō/* on] New Year's Day. However, concerning the medications listed above [in this article], on the eighth day [of the first month] collect them again and send them to the place where the Gosai-e is held in the ceremonial compound of the eighth ministries; on the fourteenth day, [at the end of the rite,] return them.

div.note: On the medications of the twelfth month for the royal consort.
div.p:
On the medications of the twelfth month for the royal consort.
Four-flavor *richū/* pellets, seven-*qi/* pellets, eight-flavor *richū/* pellets, *kankyō/* pellets, *ubai/* pellets, *goshuyu/* pellets, *tōki/* pellets, *shakuyaku/* pellets, *shinmyō/* ointment, great ointment for ten-thousand maladies, ointment for a thousand poxes and ten-thousand maladies, *chinchū/* ointment, Jīvaka's ointment, *zokufū/* ointment, one dose each.

For the preparation of the medications arrange: eight *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *ninjin/*; eight *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kanzō/*; three *ryō/* of *keishin/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kunrokukō/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *fūkō/*; nine *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *kankyō/*; eleven *ryō/* of *byakujutsu/*; twelve *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *daiō/*; fourteen *ryō/* and three *bu/* of shokusanshō; three *bu/* of *hange/* [Pinellia ternata/pinellia tuber]; two *ryō/* of *teirekishi/* [seeds of *Draba nemorosa/*]; three *bu/* of *kikyō/*; five *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *saishin/*; one *kin/*, one *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *goshuyu/*; three *bu/* of *shōbu/*; two *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *bukuryō/*; seven *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kyūkyū/*; three *bu/* of *shion/*; three *bu/* of gypsum; three *bu/* of peach [*Prunus persica/*] kernel; seven *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *uzu/*; two *ryō/* of wheat [*Triticum aestivum/*]; four *ryō/* of bitter apricot kernel ; two *ryō/* of fermented beans; one *ryō/* of *ōren/*; one *ryō/* of *ōbaku/* [bark of *Phellodendron amurense/*/Amur cork tree]; five *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *ōgon/*; four *ryō/* of *jukugai/* [dried fruit of *Artemisia princeps/*/Japanese mugwort]; twenty pieces of *ubai/*; one *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *kijitsu/*; five *ryō/* of *tōki/*; thirteen *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakushi/*; thirteen *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *zenko/*; one *kin/*, four *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *bushi/*; three *ryō/* of *rengyō/*; two *ryō/* of *rojo/*; four *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakuren/*; two *ryō/* of *sokuzu/*; two *ryō/* of *shōriku/* [*Phytolacca japonica/*/Japanese pokeweed root]; one *kin/* and three *ryō/* of *hōsō/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shōma/*; two *ryō/* of *ōgi/*; two *ryō/* of *saiko/*; two *ryō/* of *chiyu/* [*Sanguisorba officinalis/*/great burnet root]; two *ryō/* of *botan/* [*Paeonia suffruticosa/*/mountain peony root bark]; three *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *daigeki/*; six *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *shakuyaku/*; one *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *genjin/* [*Scrophularia buergeriana/*/figwort root]; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *hakutōkō/* [*Pulsatilla cernua/* root]; two *bu/* of *shishi/* [*Gardenia jasminoides/*/Cape jasmin fruit]; one *ryō/* of *jagan/*; one *ryō/* of *dokkatsu/*; five *ryō/* of *kijiō/*; twenty stalks of *gaihaku/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of Japanese pine resin [*Pinus thumbergii/*]; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of dragon bones; three *ryō/* of *seimokkō/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakubi/*; three *ryō/* of azalea [*Rhododendron/*] dried flowers; one small *to/*, one *shō/* and one *gō/* of infusion of sweet vine;

five *kin/* of wild boar fat; one *jō/* and three *shaku/* of oiled cloth; one *jō/* of silk; one *ton/* of silk floss; three *jō/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind; three large *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings from Aki Province; forty sheets of paper; six jars, two bowls, two plates, ten box-shaped *sake/* cups, two *tataibe/* pots, all Sue ware; two large containers; three *oribitsu/* containers; five *shō/* each of *sake/* and rice vinegar; two *koku/* and five *to/* of new charcoal.

[For the heir apparent,] *byakusan/*, one dose; *doshōsan/*, one dose; *toso/*, one dose 〈serve them all as above [as done for the *tennō/*].〉 Seven *qi/* pellets, two doses; four flavor *richū/* pellets, four doses. For the offering of the medications prepare: two lacquered tables 〈place the *toso/* on one, and the *byakusan/* on the other;〉 three white bronze bowls; four plates to collect leftovers with *ban'e/* decorations; one red pouch 〈length two *shaku/*;〉 one *ryō/* of strings for the pouch; ten sheets of paper; two *bu/* of mulberry bark strings.

For the preparation of the medications arrange: nine *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *ninjin/*; nine *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kanzō/*; three *bu/* of *keishin/*; five *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kankyō/*; ten *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *ban'e/*; five *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *daiō/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *bushi/*; four *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kikyō/*; three *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *shokushō/*; three *ryō/* of *bōfū/*; two *bu/* of *bakkatsu/*; four *ryō/* of *uzu/*; three *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *saishin/*; two *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *maō/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *hange/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *goshuyu/*;one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shōbu/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *bukuryō/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kyūkyū/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shion/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of gypsum; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *saiko/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of peach kernels. Seven *shaku/* of oiled cloth and two *oribitsu/* containers 〈as for other tools, use the same as those used for the august medications [for the *tennō/*].〉

As for the aforesaid [medications for the royal consort and for the heir apparent], in compounding and presenting them follow the above model [i.e., the *tennō/*'s], but have all those of rank lower than head of the Bureau [of Medications] and higher than apprentice of *i/*[*jutsu/*] bring the medication to court and present them.

Every year in the twelfth month, produce 415 doses of *byakusan/* [to be distributed on New Year's as remuneration to those of the fifth rank and above]. Have apprentices of *i/*[*jutsu/*] and needles pack them and write the name [of the medication] and other information on [the wrapping paper]. For its preparation, make ready: two silk sieves 〈two *shaku/* and five *sun/* each;〉 503 sheets of wrapping paper 〈allocate one *shō/* to each sheet;〉 two large *kin/* and five *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings; eight *to/*, two *shō/* and six *gō/* of rice vinegar to soak the *bushi/* 〈soak one *ryō/* each in one *gō/* [of rice vinegar];〉 eight *to/*, two *shō/* and six *gō/* of new charcoal to roast the *bushi/* 〈roast one *ryō/* each with one *gō/* [of charcoal];〉 four knives for scraping; five bundles of hinoki cypress lumber 〈to be used for 503 wooden pieces to clasp the powder; the length of each piece of lumber is less than six *shaku/* and more than five *shaku/*; the length of each of the 503 pieces is one *shaku/* and five *sun/*.〉 Apply in advance and obtain the above from the Ministry of the Royal Household. However, decide the quantities necessary each year on the basis of the [eligible] recipients.

On the last day of the year, place five *to/* of sample *byakusan/* and fifty sheets of paper to be presented to the royal palace in a lacquered small continental-style chest, and place it on top of a plain-wood tall table. On the same day, present samples of twenty-five types of medicinal herbs [from the bureau's physic garden to the *tennō/*] 〈four *ryō/* each of *maō/*, *tanjin/* [*Salvia miltiorrhiza/*/Chinese salvia root and rhizome], *jiō/*, *ōgon/*, *anryo/* [*Artemisia keiskeana/*], *kanzō/* 萱草 [*Hemerocallis/*/daylily], *bakumontō/* [dried root of *Ophiopogon japonicus/*], *tenmontō/* [dried root of *Asparagus cochinchinensis/*/Chinese asparagus], *kubaku/* [*Dianthus chinensis/*/pink dianthus aerial part], *ōkiku/*[dried flowers of *Chrysanthemum morifolium/*/Japanese chrysanthemum], *kuko/*, *jagan/*, *chiyu/*, *shion/*, *gaihaku/*, *sekishōzu/* [*Vigna angularis/*/azuki bean], *byakugō/* [*Lilium/*/lily bulb], *kyūkyū/*, *daiō/*, *shōriku/*, *daisan/* [*Allium sativum/*/garlic bulb], *sanshuyu/* [Cornus officinalis/Japanese cornel fruit], *goshuyu/*, *ubai/*, peach kernels. For their preparation, follow the same procedure as above [as for *byakusan/*].〉 All those in the Ministry of the Royal Household with a rank lower than deputy director, and those in the Bureau of Medications with a rank lower than head of the bureau 〈six people for each table. It includes apprentices of *i/*[*jutsu/*]. The same also applies to the carrying of the table for *shōbu/* in the next article,〉 will together carry the tables to the court and present them. Once this procedure is completed, leave. The deputy director [of the Ministry of the Royal Household] will remain and report [to the *tennō/*] 〈as for the words to be pronounced here, refer to the protocols for the Ministry of the Royal Household.〉 As for the *byakusan/* for the royal consort and the heir apparent, follow this same procedure. Those in the Bureau of Medications with a rank lower than head and higher than apprentice of *i/*[*jutsu/*] will carry the table to court and present them 〈the number of people is the same as above [for the *tennō/*].〉

On this day, also distribute *byakusan/* to those of the fifth rank and higher 〈the Ministry of Central Affairs, the Ministry of Ceremonies and the Ministry of Military Affairs will send a list of names in advance.〉 Those of rank lower than prince of royal blood and higher than second rank will receive three *shō/* each; those of the third rank, two *shō/* each; those of the fourth rank, one *shō/* each; those of the fifth rank, five *gō/*.

div.note: Miscellaneous medications as remuneration [to those of the fifth rank and above]
div.p:
Miscellaneous medications as remuneration [to those of the fifth rank and above]
Four-flavor *richū/* pellets, twenty doses; seven-*qi/* pellets, thirteen doses; *kankyō/* pellets, seven doses; *ubai/* pellets, twenty doses; *goshuyu/* pellets, three doses; *tōki/* pellets, ten doses; *shakuyaku/* pellets, ten doses; *shinmyō/* ointment, three doses; great ointment for ten-thousand maladies, three doses; ointment for a thousand poxes and ten-thousand maladies, three doses; *chūsha/* [carriage-stopping] pellets, ten doses; *kengoshi/* [seeds of *Ipomoea nil/*/Japanese morning glory] pellets, five doses; *ōren/* pellets, four doses; thirteen-element *kariroku/* pellets, two doses; *daiō/* ointment, two doses; *shōma/* ointment, three doses.

For the preparation of the medications arrange: four *kin/*, seven *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *ninjin/*; three *kin/*, fourteen *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kanzō/*; ten *ryō/* of *keishin/*; four *ryō/* of *kariroku/*; four *ryō/* of *birōji/* [*Areca catechu/*/areca nut]; eight *kin/*, eight *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kankyō/*; four *kin/* and nine *ryō/* of *byakujutsu/*; seven *kin/* and eight *ryō/* of *daiō/*; four *kin/*, ten *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *shokushō/*; nine *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *hange/*; nine *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kikyō/*; one *kin/*, two *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *saishin/*; four *kin/*, four *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *goshuyu/*; nine *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *shōbu/*; eleven *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *bukuryō/*; two *kin/*, ten *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kyūkyū/*; nine *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *shion/*; nine *ryō/* and three *bu/* of gypsum; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *saiko/*; one *kin/*, thirteen *ryō/* and three *bu/* of peach kernels; one *kin/*, six *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *uzu/*; fourteen *ryō/* of wheat; two *kin/* and two *ryō/* of bitter apricot kernel; one *kin/* of fermented soy beans; five *kin/* and eight *ryō/* of *ōren/*; one *kin/* and five *ryō/* of *ōbaku/*; three *kin/* and eight *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *ōgon/*; one *kin/* and four *ryō/* of *jukugai/*; 400 pieces of *ubai/*; twelve *ryō/* and three *bu/* of dried *kijitsu/*; three *kin/* and fifteen *ryō/* of *tōki/*; five *kin/* and one *ryō/* of *byakushi/*; two *kin/*, eight *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *zenko/*; three *kin/* and eight *ryō/* of *bushi/*; fifteen *ryō/* of *rengyō/*; six *ryō/* of *rojo/*; twelve *ryō/* of *byakuren/*; one *kin/* and two *ryō/* of *sokuzu/*; six *ryō/* of *shōriku/*; nine *ryō/* of *hōsō/*; thirteen *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shōma/*; six *ryō/* of *ōgi/*; six *ryō/* of *chiyu/*; six *ryō/* of *botan/*; ten *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *daigeki/*; one *kin/*, thirteen *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *shakuyaku/*; five *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *genjin/*; four *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *hakutōkō/*; one hundred and fifty pieces of *shishi/* kernels; twelve *ryō/* of *jagan/*; three *ryō/* of *dokkatsu/*; fifteen *ryō/* of *kijiō/*; fifty-two stalks of *gaihaku/*; two *ryō/* of *tachibana/* orange dried peel; one *kin/* and four *ryō/* of *bōshō/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kuseki/* [*Cibotium barometz/*/Scythian lamb rhizome]; three *kin/* and thirteen *ryō/* of *kengoshi/*; one *kin/* and four *ryō/* of *teirekishi/*; six *ryō/* of *rōro/*; one *kin/* and fourteen *ryō/* of animal hide gelatin; five small *to/*, one *shō/* and one *gō/* of infusion of sweet vine;

five *kin/* of wild boar fat; nine *shō/* of *sake/*; two *to/* and eight *shō/* of rice vinegar; one *koku/* of glutinous rice; three *to/* of germinated rice; one *hiki/*, one *jō/* and one *shaku/* of oiled cloth; two *jō/* and two *shaku/* of coarse plain silk; eight *shaku/* of silk gauze; two *tan/*, one *jō/* and five *shaku/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind; one *ton/* and four *ryō/* of silk floss; one large *kin/* and four *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings from Aki Province; 195 sheets of paper; fourteen jars; four *hotogi/* jars; seven *oribitsu/* containers; five large containers; half dried-gourd to be used as a ladle; one water bucket; one ladle; four *koku/* of new charcoal; 1,200 *kin/* of firewood 〈this amount also includes the firewood necessary for the production of medications for the *tennō/*.〉

As for the aforesaid [medications], use the procedures illustrated above. Once the production is completed, present them on the same day as the royal medications [for the *tennō/* produced in] the twelfth month.

div.note: On the ingredients necessary to make *jiō/* [*Rehmannia glutinosa/*] infusion
div.p:
On the ingredients necessary to make *jiō/* [*Rehmannia glutinosa/*] infusion
Twenty *koku/* of *kijiō/* 〈ten *koku/* presented by Izumi Province, ten *koku/* obtained from the physic garden [attached to the Bureau of Medications];〉 one* jō/* and two *shaku/* of silk floss; six *shaku/* of coarse plain silk to strain the infusion; six sheets of coarse plain silk to cover the jars 〈each one *shaku/* in length and nine *sun/* in width;〉 one bowl; one sheet of coarse plain silk to cover the bowl 〈length one *shaku/*, width nine *sun/*;〉 one *ton/* and a half of silk to cover the mouth of the cauldron; two *tan/* and four *jō/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind to squeeze the *jiō/*; three *ton/* of silk floss; one *tan/* of tradable cloth; three *jō/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind to cover the *yuka/* jar 〈each four *shaku/* in length, two times the standard width〉 twenty *kin/* of ropes for the lathe made with boiled hemp fiber 〈in case of damage, request a replacement;〉 five *jō/* of clean aprons made of cloth collected as tax-in-kind 〈six *shaku/* each;〉 five sets of outer work garment 〈six *shaku/* each;〉 one piece of towel 〈length five *shaku/*;〉 six *shō/* of oil for torches; three half-dried gourds to be used as ladles to pour the infusion [of *jiō/*]; two draining baskets [to filter scum]; six *yuka/* jar where to store the fluid extracted [from the *jiō/*]; sixteen Sue ware jars where to store the *jiō/* infusion 〈each to receive more than five *shō/*;〉 six *tataibe/* pots where to pour the fluid extracted [from the *jiō/*]; one Sue ware bowl where to pour a sample of infusion [of *jiō/*] 〈also add a plate;〉 three large containers; three ladles; sixteen sheets of paper 〈as material to cover the mouth of the jars [in which the *jiō/* infusion will be stored];〉 one large *kin/* of mulberry bark strings to tie and secure the mouth of the jars; 2,400 *kin/* of firewood; twenty *koku/* of new charcoal.

Provide three high officials [in the Bureau of Medications], four royal physicians 〈as for the aforesaid officials, increase or decrease their number depending on the circumstances〉 and three minor functionaries with one *jō/* of coarse plain silk and two *ton/* of silk floss each as pure clothes. Provide ten apprentices of medications and two palanquin bearers [in charge of carrying the *jiō/*] with two *jō/* and seven *shaku/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind each 〈upper garment, two *jō/*; *hakama/* trousers, seven *shaku/*.〉

As for the aforesaid miscellaneous items, submit an application to the Ministry of Royal Affairs on the first day of the ninth month and receive them. However, if there is a variation in the amount of *jiō/*, also adjust the number of miscellaneous items to request based on that. During the period of production of the infusion, supply [those involved in its production] with *sake/* and food for no more than sixteen days.

div.note: [On the offering of *shōbu/* and *namakomo/* on the fifth day of the fifth month]
div.p: [On the occasion of the seasonal celebrations at court] on the fifth day of the fifth month, in order to present *shōbu/* and *namakomo/* [non desiccated *Zizania latifolia/*/wild rice] 〈members of the Bureau will prepare these〉 arrange four tables made of unbarked lumber 〈two tables are to be used for the offering to the *tennō/*, and two tables are for the distribution to court officials. The Bureau will prepare them all;〉 six *ryō/* of *karamushi/* [*Boehmeria nivea/*/ramie]; and four *kin/* of *tsuzura/* [*Sinomenium acutum/*/Asian moonseed] 〈request these to the Ministry of the Royal Household.〉 All those in the Ministry of the Royal Household with a rank lower than deputy director, and those in the Bureau of Medications with a rank lower than head will carry these together, will enter the venue in question and present them. Once done, they will take their leave. The deputy director [of the Ministry of the Royal Household] will remain and report [to the *tennō/*] 〈as for the words to be pronounced here, refer to the protocols for the Ministry of the Royal Household.〉 For the royal consort and the heir apparent, utilize two tables of unbarked lumber each 〈one for the royal consort and the heir apparent, one for the distribution to court officials.〉

div.note: [On the *kōji/* mold and *ōgon/* to be used in the production of medications]
div.p: Every year obtain from the Ministry of the Royal Household the wheat to be used as material to make *kōji/* for the production of medications 〈two *to/* as material for the royal medications [for the *tennō/*], eight *to/* as material for miscellaneous medications to be distributed as remuneration to court officials;〉 and seven *to/* of glutinous rice to be used to steam and desiccate fifty *kin/* of *ōgon/*.

div.note: [On the offering of *goshuyu/* on the ninth day of the ninth month]
div.p: [On the occasion of the seasonal celebration at court] on the ninth day of the ninth month, hand over twenty bunches of *goshuyu/* to the [inner palace's] Office of Medications and have them present it [to the *tennō/*].

Present to the *tennō/* three large *shō/*, one *gō/* and five *shaku/* per day. For the materials needed for the production of one year [of milk]: three *jō/* and one *shaku/* of silk floss 〈use them [to make] twenty-one sieves, eight of them, one *shaku/* and six *sun/* each in size; and [the other] thirteen, one *shaku/* and four *sun/* each in size;〉 four *jō/* and two *shaku/* of red silk; four *jō/* and two *shaku/* of green silk to be used at the back 〈both to be used as materials to cover two tables; length seven *shaku/*, three times the standard width each;〉 two *jō/* and four *shaku/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind 〈to be used to cover the tables on rainy days; each six *shaku/* in length, two *no/*;〉 three *hiki/* of acorn-color silk from the eastern provinces 〈to be used for the clothes of the three men who will carry the tables, one *hiki/* for each person;〉 five *tan/*, two *jō/* and five *shaku/* of bleached hemp cloth 〈three *jō/* and three *shaku/* for the men [who will carry the tables], respectively four *shaku/* each as fabric for their sashes and seven *shaku/* for their *hakama/* trousers; three *tan/* and three *shaku/* for the three men who will milk the cows, respectively three *jō/* and six *shaku/* as fabric for their pure unlined kimonos, and seven *shaku/* for their *hakama/* trousers; one *tan/*, three *jō/* and one *shaku/* for the three men who will carry the tables, respectively four *shaku/* each as fabric for two short-sleeved kimonos, five *shaku/* each for two pieces of outer work garment; as fabric for three pieces of cloth to wipe the Sue ware bowls, three *shaku/* each; as fabric for two sieves to cut water, four *shaku/* each; as fabric for two headgears, three *shaku/* each; as fabric for two towels, three *shaku/* each; one *jō/* as fabric for a cloth to restrain the cows' legs; seven *shaku/* as fabric to wrap around the cows' abdomen; as fabric for three cloths to wipe milk, three *shaku/* each;〉 five *ryō/* of silk thread 〈to sew the sieves and the clothes and *hakama/* trousers for the men [who will carry the tables];〉 five bowls of Sue ware; jars and flat flasks, two each; Sue ware *tataibe/* pots, container, *sarake/* pot and washing basin, one each; two tall stands; two plain wood chests; one stand to be used to carry loads; two wooden lids 〈all to be used to collect milk;〉 one barrel 〈to store the rice and soy bean gruel used as cow fodder;〉 one *shō/* of oil 〈to be used on the last day of the twelfth month;〉 one hundred and fifty *kin/* of firewood per day 〈in order to cook the rice gruel for the cows;〉 one *to/* and four *shō/* per day of rice and soy beans to be used as cow fodder for the seven dairy cows 〈one *shō/* for each cow.〉 As for the above, request and receive them every month from the Ministry of the Royal Household.

As yearly fodder for the seven dairy cows and the seven calves, 4,434 *kin/* of dried grass will be needed. 〈Yamashiro Province will provide 2,332 *kin/* as cultivated fodder and 500 *kin/* as gathered fodder; Naniwa Province will provide 1,603 *kin/* as cultivated fodder.〉

div.note: On the materials necessary for the production of the royal medications
div.p:
On the materials necessary for the production of the royal medications
Two *koku/* of sesame [*Sesamum indicum/*] 〈to be made into a paste;〉 one *to/* of fermented beans 〈to be used in the production of miscellaneous medications;〉 two *to/* of foxtail millet [*Castanea crenata/*] 〈to be used to bring water to boil;〉 three *to/* of salt 〈to be used to boil water and steam-iron;〉 one piece of curtains made of cloth collected as tax-in-kind 〈length seven *shaku/*, three *no/*;〉 one plain wood chest; one mortar 〈also attach a pestle;〉 720 *kin/* of firewood.
As for the aforesaid, request all items from sesame to salt every year in the twelfth month from the Ministry of Royal Household. However, as for the curtains, the plain wood chest and the mortar, only request a new one in case of damage [to the ones currently in use].

div.note: On the materials for the production of *hafuni/* (white [face] powder) for the *tennō/*
div.p:
On the materials for the production of *hafuni/* (white [face] powder) for the *tennō/*
One *koku/* and five *to/* of glutinous rice; one *koku/* of foxtail millet 〈request them from the Office of the Court Ladies;〉 two *jō/* of silk floss as fabric for sixteen pouches made from lined silk cloths 〈for the *tennō/* and for his consort;〉 two *jō/* of silk floss to be used as fabric for four pieces of curtains to desiccate the white [face] powder; four silk sieves 〈five *shaku/* each;〉 two *tan/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind 〈to be used for the four curtains. Two *jō/* each;〉 three *ryō/* of silk thread to sew; forty sheets of wrapping paper; four plain wood chests; four large containers for water 〈capacity of above five *to/*;〉 three ladles; two bamboo mats; two long straw mats 〈as seats for the women's physicians;〉 four containers; four sake barrels; two stands to carry loads 〈as for the three items above, only request a replacement in case of damage [to the ones currently in use].〉 The fourteen women's physicians that will assist [in the operations above] will receive one *shō/* of steamed rice, one *shaku/* of salt, one *gō/* of *hishio/* with lees and three *gō/* of sake per day per person. Supply the aforesaid for no longer than thirty days.

On the occasion of royal processions, one high-ranking official and one royal physician [from the Bureau of Medications] will, at the head of four apprentices of medications, carry the medications [for the *tennō/*] and accompany him. If the royal procession includes an overnight stop, they will, at the head of apprentices of *i/*[*jutsu/*], have them carry one *tan/* of crude medicinal herbs, various texts of prescriptions and materials [necessary for the compounding of medications]. 〈As for the types of medications and materials, they will be decided depending on the circumstances. 〉 As for the carriers, request them to the Ministry of the Royal Household. In addition, for the attires and the provisions for the provincial corvée laborers and the carriers, likewise submit a request to the Ministry of the Royal Household.

Those who will escort the *tennō/* on the occasion of the procession to perform his ablutions for the Daijō-e as part of the enthronement rituals, namely one assigned official from the Bureau of Medications and one royal physician, will be provided with an attire of a color appropriate to their rank 〈for those of the fifth and sixth rank, follow their respective colors.〉 The two apprentices of medications will each be given a crimson unlined kimono woven with fine thread, white *hakama/* trousers and a non-silk sash; the two provincial corvée laborers will each be given a yellow unlined kimono made of cloth collected as tax-in-kind, white *hakama/* trousers and a non-silk sash; the two provincial corvée helpers will be given two indigo non-silk unlined kimono, two pairs of white hemp *hakama/* trousers and two hemp sashes. As for all the above, request them to the Ministry of the Royal Household and collect them from the Ministry of Great Storehouse.

div.note: [On the royal princess serving at the Ise Shrine]
div.p: On the occasion of the departure of the royal princess designated to serve at the Grand Shrine [of Ise], hand over twelve doses of medications to the person in charge of escorting her off 〈seven-*qi/* pellets, *goshuyu/* pellets, *shakuyaku/* pellets, four-flavor *richū/* pellets, *kankyō/* pellets, Liaodong pellets, two doses each.〉 On the types of medicinal herbs to use, consult books of prescriptions. As for other necessary items: six *shaku/* and five *sun/* of oiled cloth to wrap the medications; eighteen sheets of paper; five *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings; four *shaku/* of silk as fabric for two sieves; two *shaku/* of silk gauze as fabric for one loose sieve; two *shō/* of rice vinegar; one small *oribitsu/* container to store the medications; twelve men to crush [the medicinal herbs] 〈each man will pound one dose per day;〉 two *to/* and four *shō/* of rice 〈two *shō/* per person per day;〉 two *gō/* and four *shaku/* of salt 〈two *shaku/* per person per day.〉

div.note: Fifty-three types for the Bureau of the High Priestess of Ise
div.p:
On the miscellaneous medications prepared as yearly provisions for certain offices
Fifty-three types for the Bureau of the High Priestess of Ise
Seven *ryō/* and four *shu/* of *bōshō/*; one *ryō/*, two *bu/* and four *shu/* of *bōfū/*; two *ryō/*, three *bu/* and four *shu/* of *maō/*; nine *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *jagan/*; one *ryō/* and three *bu/* of gypsum; seven *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kyūkyū/*; one kin, 4 *ryō/*, two *bu/* and four *shu/* of *daiō/*; ten *ryō/* of *ninjin/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shion/*; five *ryō/* of *saiko/*; eleven *ryō/*, two *bu/* and two *shu/* of *ōgon/*; one *ryō/* and two *shu/* of *ōren/*; two *bu/* and one *shu/* of *sōkyō/*; six *ryō/* of *shakuyaku/*; six *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *rōro/*; fifteen *ryō/* of *rengyō/*; ten *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakuren/*; four *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *rojo/*; nine *kin/* and fifteen *ryō/* of *bushi/*; seven *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kankyō/*; sixty-four *kin/* and eight *ryō/* of wild boar fat; seven *kin/*, ten *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakujutsu/*; fourteen *kin/* and four *ryō/* of *uzu/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *hange/*; nine *kin/*, five *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kikyō/*; seven *kin/* and fourteen *ryō/* of *saishin/*; one *kin/* and six *ryō/* of *goshuyu/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shōbu/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *bukuryō/*; two *kin/* and two *bu/* of *shokushō/*; two *ryō/* of peach kernel; twelve *ryō/*, one *bu/* and two *shu/* of *kijitsu/*; two *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *teirekishi/*; two *ryō/*, three *bu/* and two *shu/* of bitter apricot kernel ; two *bu/* and two *shu/* of *kōboku/*; two-hundred sheets of *shishi/*; eleven *ryō/* and two *shu/* of *shōma/*; two *bu/* of *kanran/*; one *gō/* and one *shaku/* of fermented soy beans; two *shō/* and one *gō/* of *zenko/*; two *shō/* and one *gō/* of *byakushi/*; four *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *tōki/*; one *kin/* and one *bu/* of *sokuzu/*; four *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *shōriku/*; three *kin/* and five *ryō/* of *hōsō/*; four *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *ōgi/*; four *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *botan/*; four *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *chiyu/*; five *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *daigeki/*; three *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *genjin/*; three *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *hakutōkō/*; five *ryō/* and one *bu/* of azalea; one *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *bakkatsu/*.

div.note: Twenty-five types for the Bureau of Skilled Artisans
div.p:
Twenty-five types for the Bureau of Skilled Artisans
One *kin/* and two *ryō/* each of *saishin/* and *byakujutsu/*; fourteen *ryō/* of *kikyō/*; one *kin/* of *bushi/*; three *ryō/* each of *rojo/*, *hange/*, *byakuren/*, *shōriku/*, *hōsō/*, *saiko/*, *botan/*, *chiyu/*, *uzu/*, *daigeki/* and *genjin/*; ten *ryō/* of *shokushō/*; seven *ryō/* of *daiō/*; two *shō/* of *goshuyu/*; four *ryō/* each of *bukuryō/*, *shion/*, *tōki/* and *kyūkyū/*; six *ryō/* of *byakushi/*; two *shō/* of peach kernels; one *ryō/* of gypsum.

div.note: Forty types for the Bureau of Carpentry
div.p:
Forty types for the Bureau of Carpentry
Ten *kin/* of *saishin/*; twelve *kin/* of *byakujutsu/*; ten *kin/* of *kikyō/*; eighteen *kin/* of *bushi/*; six *ryō/* of *bakkatsu/*; two *kin/* and ten *ryō/* of *daiō/*; fourteen *ryō/* of *bōfū/*; one *kin/* each of *tanjin/*, *ranshitsu/*, gypsum, *seimokkō/*, *shion/* and *saiko/*; two *kin/* and eight *ryō/* of *tōki/*; two *kin/* each of *shoyo/* [*Dioscorea japonica/*/Japanese yam rhizome], *kōboku/*, *goshuyu/*, *byakushi/*, *yuhi/* [bark of *Ulmus davidiana/* var. *japonica/*/Japanese elm tree], *bukuryō/*, dried *jiō/*, bitter apricot kernels, *mokuran/* [bark of *Magnolia liliiflora/*], *byakuren/*, *shōriku/* and *tochū/* [bark of *Eucommia ulmoides/*/Eucommia stem bark]; three *kin/* each of *shokushō/*, *shōma/*, *ōgon/*, *ōren/*, peach kernels and wild kudzu root [*Pueraria montana/*]; two *ryō/* of *sanshuyu/*; four *kin/* of *sekkoku/* [*Dendrobium nobile/*]; five *kin/* each of *dokkatsu/* and *goshitsu/* [*Achyranthes japonica/*/Japanese chaff flower root]; two *kin/* and eight *ryō/* of *kyūkyū/*; eight *ryō/* of *zenko/*; ten *ryō/* each of *yakan/* [*Iris japonica/*/blackberry lily rhizome] and *shōbu/*.

div.note: Forty-seven types each for the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards of the Left and of the Right
div.p:
Forty-seven types each for the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards of the Left and of the Right
Two *kin/* and eight *ryō/* each of *daiō/* and *shokushō/*; ten *ryō/* each of *ninjin/* and *mokubōki/* [root of *Sinomenium acutum/*]; five *ryō/* each of *hange/*, *kikyō/*, *shion/* and *sōkyō/*; three *ryō/* each of gypsum and *jagan/*; eight *ryō/* each of *saiko/*, peach kernels, *shakuyaku/*, *ōgi/*,*shinkyō/* [*Gentiana macrophylla/*/large leaf gentian root], *rengyō/*, *seimokkō/*, *rojo/*, *botan/* and *goshitsu/*; one *kin/* and eight *ryō/* each of *goshuyu/*, *bukuryō/*, *byakushi/*, *jukugai/*, *kanzui/* [root and rhizome of *Euphorbia sieboldiana/*/ Siebold's spurge]; four *ryō/* each of *shōbu/* and *teirekishi/*; one *kin/* and four *ryō/* of *kyūkyū/*; four *kin/* of *uzu/*; fourteen *ryō/* each of *ōgon/*, *ōren/*, *bōfū/*, *zenko/*, *kishi/*, *in'u/* [stalk and leaves of *Skimmia japonica/*], and *ōbaku/*; 1,400 pieces of bitter apricot kernels; one kin each of *kōboku/*, *shōma/* and *maō/*; two *kin/* and eight *ryō/* of *tōki/*; three *kin/* of *byakujutsu/*; thirteen *ryō/* of *daigeki/*; one *kin/* and four *ryō/* each of *hōsō/*, *kōji/* mold and *dokkatsu/*; one *kin/* and three *ryō/* of *saishin/*.
The aforementioned are ingredients for the following medications for each Headquarters: eighty-eight doses of *byakusan/*; three doses of *bukuryō/* powder; seven doses of *suidō/* powder; two doses of *shakuyaku/* pellets; seven doses each of *taisō/* [dried *Ziziphus jujuba/*/Chinese jujube] pellets, and *ōren/* pellets; four doses of six-ingredient *kankyō/* pellets; fifteen doses of *tōki/* pellets; two doses each of ointment for ten-thousand winds and ointment for ten-thousand maladies; and three doses of ointment for a thousand-poxes and ten-thousand maladies.

div.note: Thirty-four types for the Headquarters of the Gate Guards of the Left and of the Right
div.p:
Thirty-four types for the Headquarters of the Gate Guards of the Left and of the Right
Fifteen *ryō/* of *daiō/*, five *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kanzō/*; seven *ryō/* of *ninjin/*; fourteen *ryō/* of *byakushi/*; five *ryō/* of *hange/*; two *kin/* two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *uzu/*; three *ryō/* and two *bu/* each of *kikyō/* and *shion/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* each of gypsum, peach kernel, *mokubōki/* and *bōfū/*; one *kin/* and one *ryō/* of *goshuyu/*; six *ryō/* of *saiko/*; two *ryō/* each of *shōbu/*, *daigeki/* and *dokkatsu/*; eight *ryō/* of *bukuryō/*; ten *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *saishin/*; one *kin/* ten *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *shokushō/*; four *ryō/* each of *shakuyaku/*, *teirekishi/*, bitter apricot kernel and *kōboku/*; one *kin/* two *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *kyūkyū/*; twelve *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakujutsu/*; eight *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *tōki/*; four *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *ōgon/*; three *ryō/* of *maō/*; two *bu/* each of *ōren/*, *sōkyō/*, and *hōsō/*; eleven *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *zenko/*; one *kin/* and two *ryō/* of *kōji/* mold.
The aforementioned are ingredients for the following medications for each Headquarters: forty-eight doses of *byakusan/*; three doses each of *bukuryō/* powder and powder for a hundred poisons; two doses each of seven-qi pellets, *shakuyaku/* pellets, *goshuyu/* pellets, and four-flavor *richū/* pellets; one dose of *onpaku/* pellets; two doses each of *shinmyō/* ointment and ointment for a thousand poxes and ten-thousand maladies.

div.note: Thirty types for the Headquarters of the Palace Guards of the Left and of the Right
div.p:
Thirty types for the Headquarters of the Palace Guards of the Left and of the Right
Four *shō/* and five *gō/* of *goshuyu/*; one *ryō/* and two *bu/* each of *zenko/* and *byakushi/*; ten *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *byakujutsu/*; six *ryō/* and one *bu/* of *kyūkyū/*; five *shō/* and three *shaku/* of *shokushō/*; three *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *saishin/*; eight *ryō/* of *tōki/*; four *ryō/* each of *bushi/*, *shakuyaku/*, *ōgon/* and bitter apricot kernels; thirteen *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *maō/*; two *ryō/* each of *daigeki/*, *jagan/*, *hōsō/*, *dokkatsu/*, *teirekishi/* and *kōji/* mold; seven *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *ninjin/*; one *ryō/* of *hange/*; three *bu/* of *kikyō/*; three *bu/* each of *bukuryō/*, *shion/*, gypsum, peach kernels and *shōbu/*; eight *ryō/* and three *bu/* of *kanzō/*; two *ryō/* and two *bu/* of *kanzō/*; ten sheets of *kijitsu/*.
The aforementioned are ingredients for the following medications for each Headquarters: fifty doses of *byakusan/*; one dose each of seven-*qi/* pellets, *shakuyaku/* pellets, *goshuyu/* pellets, and *kankyō/* pellets; two doses each of four-flavor *richū/* pellets and *tōki/* pellets; one dose of *shinmyō/* ointment; two doses of ointment for a thousand poxes and ten-thousand maladies.

div.note: Left and Right Bureau of the Stables
div.p:
Left and Right Bureau of the Stables
Six *shō/* and four *gō/* of sulphur to each [the Left and Right Bureau of the Stables] to be used as medication for horses 〈one *shō/* and six *gō/* per season.〉

div.note: Four types for the Bureau of the Armory
div.p:
Four types for the Bureau of the Armory
One dose each of *shinmyō/* ointment, ointment for ten thousand maladies, and *bukuryō/* powder; half dose of powder for a hundred poisons. The ingredients for the aforementioned medications are: two *ryō/* and two *bu/* each of *keishin/* and *kankyō/*; twenty *kin/* of boar fat; nine *shō/* and one *gō/* of vinegar.
[As for the items needed to compound the medications,] submit a petition to the Ministry [of the Royal Household] and collect: two *shaku/* of silk as material for a sieve; four *shaku/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind as material to extract or squeeze; four sheets of paper as material to wrap the medications; one *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings; two Sue ware jars; five *to/* of new charcoal.

div.note: Eleven types for the envoys sent to Tang [China]
div.p:
Medications for the envoys sent to foreign countries
Eleven types for the envoys sent to Tang [China]
Four doses each of rhinoceros horn pellets and *daigeki/* pellets; twelve doses each of seven-*qi/* pellets, eight-flavor *richū/* pellets, powder for a hundred poisons, and *doshōsan/*; sixteen doses of *bukuryō/* powder; six doses of *shinmyō/* ointment; eight doses each of ointment for ten-thousand maladies and *shōma/* ointment; four doses of *kōryō/* ointment.
As for the types of herbal ingredients to be used [to compound these medications], follow the instructions found in books of prescriptions. Necessary miscellaneous items are: one *jō/* and two *shaku/* of silk as material for six sieves; one *jō/*, three *shaku/*, six *sun/* and five *bu/* of oiled rough silk as wrapping; ninety-eight sheets of paper; two *kin/* and fourteen *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings; seven *to/* and seven *shō/* of vinegar; one *tan/* and four *shaku/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind; two *jō/* of non-silken cloth to wipe the mortar; twenty-three Sue ware jars; seven *to/* and nine *shō/* of new charcoal.

div.note: Fifty-nine types of crude herbs [for the envoys sent to Tang China]
div.p:
Fifty-nine types of crude herbs [for the envoys sent to Tang China]
Eight *kin/* each of *shakuyaku/*, *byakujutsu/*, *chiyu/*, and *kikyō/*; six *kin/* each of *dokkatsu/*, *zenko/*, *shōma/*, *yakan/*, *karō/* [dried fruit of *Trichosanthes kirilowii/*/Chinese snake gourd], *goshitsu/*, *bukuryō/*, *saiko/*, *uzu/*, *bushi/*, *ten'yū/*, *shōriku/*, *shokushō/*, *ōgi/*, pine resin, and *sekinansō/* [*Rhododendron/* leaves]; four *kin/* each of *daigeki/*, *bōki/*, *ōbaku/*, *shion/*, *kujin/*, and *shōbu/*; two *kin/* each of *sekii/* [*Pyrrosia lingua/*/pyrrosia dried leaves], *takusha/* [*Alisma orientale/*/water plantain rhizome and tuber], *genjin/*, *kōhon/* [*Ligusticum sinense/*/Chinese lovage rhizome], *jukugai/*, *rōro/*, *rojo/*, *kanzui/*, *jagan/*, *reiro/* [root and rhizome of *Veratrum maackii/* var. *reymondianum/*], dried *jiō/*, *kijitsu/*, root bark of mulberry [*Morus alba/*], and *tanjin/*; four *kin/* each of bitter apricot kernels, *gomishi/* [*Schisandra chinensis/* fruit/five-flavor fruit], *toshishi/* [seed of *Cuscuta japonica/*/Japanese dodder], *teirekishi/*, *jashōshi/* [fruit of *Torilis japonica/*/upright hedge-parsley], *hange/*, *hoō/* [cattail pollen], *bakumontō/* and *bokuna/*; one *to/* and six *shō/* of sesame paste; one *koku/* and two *to/* of peach kernels; eight *kin/* each of *ōgon/* and *maō/*; six *kin/* each of *ōren/*, *in'u/*, *goshuyu/*, *bōfū/*, and *tachibana/* orange dried peel; four *kin/* of *byakuren/*.
Four continental-style chests to store the miscellaneous medications 〈keep it locked;〉 eight straw mats to wrap the chest; four kin of *tsuzura/*; four *ryō/* of hemp rope; and four carrying poles.

div.note: Seventeen types for the envoys sent to Balhae
div.p:
Seventeen types for the envoys sent to Balhae
Half dose of white madam's pellets; three *ryō/* of five-aromatics pellets; one dose each of *renchū/* pellets, *goshuyu/* pellets, *kankyō/* pellets, rhinoceros horn pellets and four-flavor *richū/* pellets; two doses each of seven-*qi/* pellets and eight-flavor *richū/* pellets; half dose of *daigeki/* pellets; two doses each of *doshōsan/* and powder for a hundred poisons; three doses of *bukuryō/* powder; one dose each of *kōryō/* ointment and *shōma/* ointment; two doses of *shinmyō/* ointment; three doses of ointment for ten-thousand maladies.
As for the types of herbal ingredients to be used [to compound these medications], follow the instructions found in books of prescriptions. Necessary miscellaneous items are: six *shaku/* of silk as material for six sieves; one *shaku/* and five *sun/* of silk gauze as fabric for a loose sieve; six *shaku/* and five *sun/* of oiled rough silk as wrapping; twenty-three sheets of paper; eight *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings; five *ryō/* of silk as material to extract or squeeze; six *shaku/* and five sun of cloth collected as tax-in-kind; two *to/* and five *shō/* of vinegar; two *koku/* and five *to/* of new charcoal; five Sue ware jars; four Sue ware bowls; two *tataibe/* pots.

div.note: Eighty types of crude herbs [for the envoys sent to Balhae]
div.p:
Eighty types of crude herbs [for the envoys sent to Balhae]
Five large *kin/* of sesame paste; one *to/* and four *shō/* of peach kernels; two *kin/* each of *ōgon/*, *seidei/* [*Adenophora triphylla/* var. *japonica/*/ ladybell root], *ōren/*, *byakujutsu/*, *sekkoku/*, indigo laquer, *saishin/*, *kikyō/*, *dokkatsu/*, *tōki/*, *yakan/*, *goshitsu/*, *bukuryō/*, *byakushi/*, *shōma/*, *tachibana/* orange dried peel, *bushi/*, *uzu/*, *ten'yū/*, *ōgi/*, pine resin, *sekinansō/*, *bōki/*, *ōbaku/*, *byakuren/*, *shion/*, *bakumontō/*, *kujin/*, *kikyū/*, *kyūkyū/*, dried *jiō/*, *kijitsu/*, and kudzu root; one *kin/* each of *shakuyaku/*, *chiyu/*, *zenko/*, *hakutōkō/*, *karō/*, *bōfū/*, *saiko/*, *hōsō/*, *shōriku/*, *daigeki/*, *in'u/*, *shōbu/*, *kōhon/*, *kanzui/*, *sekii/*, *takusha/*, *genjin/*, *rōro/*, *rojo/*, *jagan/*, *reiro/*, root bark of mulberry, *sōkyō/*, *tanjin/*, *hoō/*, *hange/*, and *ryūtan/*; one *kin/* each of dragon bones, sulphur and gypsum; four *kin/* of *shokushō/*; five *shō/* of *goshuyu/*; two *shō/* each of bitter apricot kernels, *gomishi/*, *toshishi/*, *teirekishi/*, and *jashōshi/*; five *shō/* each of *ubai/*, *taisō/*, and *kōji/* mold; four *shō/* of *katei/* [calix of *Cucumis melo/*/melon]; ten pieces of antelope horns; two *kin/* of *jukugai/*; one kin each of *bokuna/* and *josei/* [*Paederia foetida/*/skunkvine aerial part and root].
Two continental-style chests to store the miscellaneous medications 〈keep it locked;〉 four straw mats to wrap the chest; two *kin/* of *tsuzura/*; eight *ryō/* of hemp rope; two carrying poles; two *dan/* of cloth collected in lieu of corvée to wrap the medication; two boxes 〈each side one *shaku/* and five *sun/*;〉 eight sheets of paper; three *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings.

div.note: Six types for the envoys sent to Silla
div.p:
Six types for the envoys sent to Silla
One dose each of eight-flavor *richū/* pellets and seven-*qi/* pellets; two doses of powder for a hundred poisons; four doses of *bukuryō/* powder; two doses each of *shinmyō/* ointment and ointment for ten-thousand maladies.
As for the types of herbal ingredients to be used [to compound these medications], follow the instructions found in books of prescriptions. Necessary miscellaneous items are: three *shaku/* of silk as material for two sieves; two *shaku/* and five *sun/* of oiled rough silk as wrapping; twelve sheets of paper; three *ryō/* of mulberry bark strings; five *shaku/* of cloth collected as tax-in-kind as material to extract or squeeze; one *to/* and six *shō/* of vinegar; four Sue ware jars to collect the ointments; one *koku/* and five *to/* of new charcoal; two *tataibe/* jars.

div.note: Twenty-four types of crude herbs [for the envoys sent to Silla]
div.p:
Twenty-four types of crude herbs [for the envoys sent to Silla]
Five *shō/* each of *hange/*, *goshuyu/*, *bokuna/* and *goshimi/*; five *kin/* each of *shōma/*, *yakan/*, *byakujutsu/*, *tōki/*, *kōboku/*, sulphur, *bukuryō/*, *ōgon/*, and *kōji/* mold; four *kin/* of *tachibana/* orange dried peel; one *to/* each of *ōren/*, peach kernels, and bitter apricot kernels; three *kin/* each of *seidei/*, *saishin/* and *chiyu/*; seven *shō/* of *bakumontō/*; one *kin/* of *shōbu/*; one *to/* of *shokushō/*; two *kin/* of *rojo/*.
Two continental-style chests to store the miscellaneous medications; four straw mats to wrap the chest; two *kin/* of *tsuzura/*; two *ryō/* of hemp rope; two carrying poles.

[Also prepare] two tall lacquered tables for the *byakusan/* to be given to foreign guests; two white boxes; two covers decorated with *kyōkechi/*; four sashes; two cloth covers 〈as for these items, after the third day, return all those that were borrowed;〉 and four yellow *hō/* 〈they will be worn by the apprentices of *i/*[*jutsu/*] who carry the tables.〉

div.note: [On the study of books of prescriptions]
div.p: In learning books of prescriptions, the following time limits will apply: 460 days for the *Classic of the Grand Basis/*; 310 days for *Newly compiled materia medica/*; 310 days for *Small Essays/*; 200 days for *Hall of Light/*; sixty days for the *Classic of the eighty-one difficult issues/*. As for the instructors [of the Bureau of Medications], reserve them the same treatment as those in the Bureau of Great Learning, and supply them with food and *sake/*, combustible oil and monetary rewards.

div.note: [On the classification of the books of prescriptions]
div.p: Classify the *Canon of Yellow Emperor: Grand Basis/* as a large book; the *Newly compiled materia medica/* as a medium book; the *Small Essays/*, the *Hall of Light/*, and the *Classic of the eighty-one difficult issues/* as short books.

div.note: [On the seats to be used during lectures]
div.p: As materials to be used to make seats for the lectures [on the books of prescriptions], two cushions made out of woven wild-rice leaf mats 〈for the instructor of *i/*[*jutsu/*] and the instructor of needles;〉 three long straw mats 〈for the apprentices.〉 Request and receive them every three years from the Ministry of the Royal Household.

div.note: [On the treatment of exceptionally accomplished apprentices]
div.p: Provide the four exceptionally accomplished apprentices [in the Bureau] with food and clothing in the same amount as that of the exceptionally accomplished apprentices in the Bureau of Great Learning.

With respect to the salary of provincial physicians, every year deduct one tenth of that amount per person and exchange that amount with products from that province that can easily be transported. Have them carried to the capital by the envoys in charge of carrying tributes presented as tax-in-kind. In case of nonpayment, inform the Bureau of Accounting and prevent the issue of a receipt to the envoys. However, this provision will not apply in case of concurrent appointment as royal physician or instructor of *i/*[*jutsu/*] and needles [and provincial physician], and in case of provincial physicians hired without going through the established procedures.

div.note: [On the payment of teachers by the provinces]
div.p: With respect to the products that provinces will send as payment for the teachers, inspect them and store them in the warehouse of the Bureau. The products paid on behalf of those who were apprentices of *i/*[*jutsu/*] and needles will be assigned to their respective instructors [*hakase/*], and the products paid on behalf of those who were apprentices of medications will be assigned to the royal physicians.

div.note: [On the medicinal herbs for those of the fifth rank or above]
div.p: If anyone of the fifth rank or above should need medicinal herbs, they will go to the Bureau to collect them.

div.note: On the miscellaneous items per annum
div.p:
On the miscellaneous items per annum
200 sheets of paper; one iron mortar; one pot; one plain crate; four knives 〈each seven *sun/* in length;〉 twenty-two hoes 〈twenty for the physic garden, two for the Bureau's building;〉 one grindstone; and four each of *motai/* jars, *tataibe/* pots and bowls.
As for the aforesaid, handle them according to the regulations laid out in the previous articles. Allocate the hoes and the grindstone once every three years 〈return the old hoes.〉 As for the mortar, the pot and the crate, request a new one in case of damage and exchange them.

div.note: On the equipment in the bureau's building
div.p:
On the equipment in the bureau's building
One scale; a one-*to/* measuring container for medications; a one-*shō/* measuring container for medications; ten iron mortars; ten iron pestles; five iron measuring spoons; six chopping knives for medicinal herbs; one lacquered long stand used for carrying loads; one curtain of acorn-colored plain coarse silk to be used against dust in the physicians' pavilion [in the royal palace] 〈length three *jō/*, ten *no/*;〉 one curtain of acorn-colored plain coarse silk to be used on the occasion of royal processions; one indigo hemp curtain. In case of damage to any of the aforesaid, submit a request to the Ministry of the Royal Household and exchange them.
The pasture of Ajihara is assigned to the Bureau as a pasture for its dairy cows. If bulls are born, they will be employed for plowing the physic garden, or for breeding.

div.note: [On the skin of cows that perished in the pasture of Ajihara]
div.p: With respect to the skins of the cows perished in the pasture of Ajihara, sell them and allocate the proceeds to repairs of the facilities of the Bureau of Medications. However, include the profit from that sale in the end-of-year ledger and submit it to the Council of State.

Two *chō/* of land located in Mizutani no shimori, on the thirteenth street of the district of Kadono in Yamashiro Province 〈its borders are marked by Mineyama to the east, the entrance of the valley of Horigoshiyama to the south, Mine to the west, Karakawai to the north〉 are perpetually designated as land for the cultivation of *jiō/* to be presented to the *tennō/*.

div.note: [On the rice paddies for the encouragement of learning]
div.p:
Rice paddies for the encouragement of learning, eighteen *chō/*
Thirteen *chō/* 〈nine *chō/* in Yamato Province, four *chō/* in Ōmi Province.〉
With respect to the above, add the land rent to the monthly allowance paid to the Bureau, and allocate it to the provisions for apprentices of *i/*[*jutsu/*] and needles.
Five *chō/* 〈in Yamato Province.〉
With respect to the above, allocate the land rent to the provisions for apprentices of medications.

As for [the provisions] listed above, have them carried [to the capital] by the envoys in charge of carrying tributes presented as tax-in-kind, and sent to the Bureau. Once [the Bureau] has inspected and stored them, release a receipt. Regarding Dazaifu, entrust [its provisions] to the envoys for additional tributes.
